it.unibo.alchemist.model.interfaces

Interface IReaction<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type which describes the concentration of a molecule A generic reaction. Every reaction in the system must implement this interface.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<IReaction<T>>, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AReaction, ChemicalReaction, Event, SAPEREGradient, SAPEREReaction

    public interface IReaction<T>
extends Comparable<IReaction<T>>, Serializable

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • canExecute

        boolean canExecute()
        Returns:
        true if the reaction can be executed (namely, all the conditions are satisfied).

      • cloneOnNewNode

        IReaction<T> cloneOnNewNode(INode<T> n)
        This method allows to clone this reaction on a new node. It may result useful to support runtime creation of nodes with the same reaction programming, e.g. for morphogenesis.
        Parameters:
        n - The node where to clone this IReaction
        Returns:
        the cloned action

      • execute

        void execute()
        Executes the reactions.

      • getActions

        List<? extends IAction<T>> getActions()
        Returns:
        The list of the actions of the IReaction. There is no specification if the list will be a copy of the internal list or a reference. It will depend on implementations. Please be careful when you modify this list.

      • getConditions

        List<? extends ICondition<T>> getConditions()
        Returns:
        The list of the conditions of the IReaction. There is no specification if the list will be a copy of the internal list or a reference. It will depend on implementations. Please be careful when you modify this list.

      • getInfluencedMolecules

        List<? extends IMolecule> getInfluencedMolecules()
        Returns:
        The list of molecules whose concentration may change after the execution of this reaction. If it returns null, it means that it will influence every other reaction with compatible context, regardless the molecules involved.

      • getInfluencingMolecules

        List<? extends IMolecule> getInfluencingMolecules()
        Returns:
        The list of the molecules whose concentration may affect the execution of the reaction. If it returns null, it means that it is influenced every other reaction with compatible context, regardless the molecules involved.

      • getInputContext

        Context getInputContext()
        Returns:
        The widest context among conditions, namely the smallest context in which the reaction can read informations.

      • getNode

        INode<T> getNode()
        Returns:
        The node in which this reaction acts.

      • getOutputContext

        Context getOutputContext()
        Returns:
        The widest context among actions, namely the smallest context in which the reaction can do modifications.

      • getRate

        double getRate()
        Returns the speed of this reaction. It is an average number, and can potentially change during the simulation, depending on the implementation.
        Returns:
        the number of times this reaction is triggered per time unit.

      • getTau

        ITime getTau()
        Returns:
        The global time at which this reaction is scheduled to be executed, according to Next Reaction algorithm

      • getTimeDistribution

        TimeDistribution<T> getTimeDistribution()
        Returns:
        the TimeDistribution for this IReaction

      • setActions

        void setActions(List<? extends IAction<T>> a)
        Sets the action list. Some implementations may not allow to change it at runtime.
        Parameters:
        a - the list of actions for this reaction

      • setConditions

        void setConditions(List<? extends ICondition<T>> c)
        Sets the condition list. Some implementations may not allow to change it at runtime.
        Parameters:
        c - the list of conditions for this action

      • update

        void update(ITime curTime,
            boolean executed,
            IEnvironment<T> env)
        Updates the times of this reaction.
        Parameters:
        executed - true if the reaction have just been executed.
        curTime - the current time of execution. This is mandatory in order to correctly compute the time shift of an already-scheduled reaction
        env - the current environment
